page.title: 05Shops
page.content: There are seven shops in the village of Waddingham including the Public House.The other six are the Post Office, Rusling's General Store, The Fish and Chip Shop, The Butcher's Shop The Hairdressers and The Antique Shop. The Post Office which is down Silver Street is owned by Mr and Mrs Smith . They sell groceries, stationery,sweets,ices,toiletries, stamps and medical appliances.People say that it was built about 80 years ago. Rusling's General Store is opposite the village green and is owned by Mr and Mrs Rusling.They sell virtually the same as the Post Office except for stamps.It was built about a hundred years ago.We think that these stores are used the most in Waddingham.
